results.title: The Last starfighter
results.creator_credit: Nick Castle, Edward Denault, Gary Adelson, Universal Pictures and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: A highly underrated science fiction produced in the wake of the Star Wars phenomenon, “The Last starfighter” is another supreme example of outer-space/fantasy that was the trend in Hollywood in the early 1980s. Lance Guest is Alex Rogan, who lives and works a dead-end job in his mother’s trailer park. His only escape: a video-game called “Starfighter”. When a mysterious stranger explains to him that “Starfighter” is more than just a game, Alex is thrust centrestage for a conflict that threatens not only Earth but the entire universe. With production design by Ron Cobb (of ‘Alien’ and ‘Star Wars’ fame) and a scorching soundtrack by Craig Safan, “The Last starfighter” is formulaic Hollywood at its most entertaining. Cast also includes Robert Preston, Dan O’Herlihy, Catherine Stewart and Barbara Bosson.

results.title: Varsity blues
results.creator_credit: Brian Robbins, Mike Tollin, Tova Laiter and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Eager to prove he is more than just another soap star, James Van Der Beek agreed to the title role of Jonathan “Mox” Moxton in this coming of age film set in Texas. Mox is a reluctant gridiron fullback in the West Canaan Coyotes who discovers his brilliance for the game after being called in to substitute for injured star player Lance Harbor (Paul Walker). Mox is not thrilled at being pushed into the limelight as it means undue attention from masochistic Coach Kilmer (Jon Voight) - eager to win the 23rd district trophy, increased pressure from his father who is using Mox to live out his own unfulfilled sporting aspirations, and grief from his girlfriend who says that Mox is deluding himself by being a football hero. Things come to a head on the eve of the final when Mox is blackmailed by Coach Kilmer into play the game “his way” or face the prospect of remaining in their one horse town when he sabotages Mox’s chance at taking up his university offer. Cast also includes Ron Lester, Scott Caan, Ali Larter and Amy Smart.

results.title: Johnny Suede
results.creator_credit: Tom Di Cillo, Ruth Waldburger, Yoram Mandel, Starr Pictures, Arena Films and Balthazar Pictures
results.brief_description: An independent off-beat cult classic about an aspiring rock musician with a complicated love life and an obsession for suede and his own carefully cultivated self-image. Johnny (Brad Pitt) is a naive but endearing musician who models himself on the 1950s pop legend, Ricky Nelson. After a pair of black suede shoes fall on him from the sky one night, he adopts the name Johnny Suede and spends his time composing inspired love songs on his guitar that add greatly to the comic and somewhat bizarre quality of the film as he dreams of rock ‘n’ roll stardom. He meets the sensuous painter Yvonne (Catherine Keener) and begins a journey of self discovery that will never quite leave his carefully fabricated image the same again, or will it? Written and directed by Tom DiCillo, who followed this genuine and beautifully odd ball effort with ‘Living in Oblivion’(1994), said to be inspired in part by his experiences in making this film, and including a cast that features Nick Cave and Tina Louise. (Awards: Golden Leopard Award for Best Film, 1991)

results.title: The Story of Qiu ju = Qiuju da guan si
results.creator_credit: Chang I-mou, Ma Fung Kwok, Youth Film Studio, Beijing Film Academy and Sil-Metropole Organisation
results.brief_description: Set in a small Chinese village, ‘The Story of Qiu Ju’ follows one woman’s crusade to seek justice from the village chief who assaults her husband, Qing Lai, after an argument over Qing’s request to build a shed for drying chilies on prime farming land. Her determination leads her to take on the entire Chinese legal system. A departure from Yimou’s earlier visually sumptuous, period dramas ‘Raise the Red Lantern’ and ‘Ju Dou’, this film adopts a plainer visual style and a satrical tone in observations of contemporary Chinese life and its critique of an overblown and hopelessly ineffective government bureacracy. Based on the novel ‘The Wan Family’s Lawsuit’ by Chen Yuan Bin. Cast includes Gong Li and Lei Que Sheng. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Land without music
results.creator_credit: Walter Forde, Max Schach, Capitol Film Corporation and J H Productions
results.brief_description: A light-hearted operetta composed by Oscar Straus and adapted for the screen by Rudolf Bernauer based on a supposedly true story that took place in the early part of the 19th century. It is a tale of forbidden music where no instruments or singing is allowed in order that the townsfolk can concentrate on more serious things such as making money to pay off the town’s debts. Stars Richard Tauber as Mario Carlini and features Jimmy Durante (Schnozzle) as Jonah J. Whistler. Cast also includes Diana Napier (Princess Regent), June Clyde (Sadie Whistler), Derrick de Marney (Rudolpho Strozzi, Esme Percy (Austrian Ambassador).

results.title: The River [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mark Rydell, Robert Cortess, Edward Lewis and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Family drama set in Eastern Tennessee. It tells the story of the trials and tribulations that beset a young farming family. Threatened by an overflowing weir, the modern world of big business and a bad harvest, the head of the family is forced to become a scab labourer in the local foundry during the strike, leaving his wife in charge of the homestead. Cast includes Mel Gibson and Sissy Spacek.

results.title: When night is falling
results.creator_credit: Patricia Rozema, Barbara Tranter, Alliance Communications and Crucial Pictures
results.brief_description: Camille, a professor of mythology at the Christian New College of Faith, and her boyfriend Martin are being pressured to marry by the principal of the college. When her dog dies Camille finds comfort with Petra, a sexy circus performer, who she meets at a laundry. As their friendship gradually develops into a love affair Camille’s life is turned upside down and she realises she must make a choice between a secure life with her fiance, or one of adventure, passion and uncertainty with Petra. Sumptuously filmed in lush colours, Rozema draws on the magic and drama of daring circus acts to symbolically convey Camille’s struggle to set herself free. Cast includes Pascale Bussieres, Rachael Crawford, Henry Czerny and Don McKellar Winner of Audience Award, Berlin Film Festival 1995.

results.title: Frankenstein
results.creator_credit: James Whale, Carl Laemmle and Universal Studios
results.brief_description: A landmark in the history of the horror film, “Frankenstein”, based on the gothic novel by Mary Wollestonecraft Shelley, drew heavily on the traditions of German Expressionism to create a stark, shadowy world where the true monsters were more often in human form. Charged with the desire to create life beyond the womb, Dr. Frankenstein (Colin Clive) constructs a man from body parts looted from freshly dug graves. The resulting “monster” (Boris Karloff) is implanted with the stolen brain of a criminal, and jolted to life by a bolt of lightning. Dr. Frankenstein’s triumph soon turns to tragedy when his creation escapes and discovers that he exists in a world which he is not welcome. Pursued by an angry mob, the creature confronts his maker on a cliff top, setting the scene for the dramatic ending atop a burning windmill. Boris Karloff helped to create one of the most recogniseable (and most imitated) cultural icons of the twenty first century with his sensitive portrayal of the creature, and the film was memorable as a whole for its striking production design, and Jack Pierce’s masterful make-up. Initially on release this film featured a prologue, warning the audience of its potential to shock. Some scenes were cut from the original film as they were deemed inappropriate for audience sensibilities of the time, such as the well-known scene where the creature throws the young girl into the lake. This video features the restored version of the film, and also includes a detailed documentary on the making of the film, produced, written and directed by David J. Skal.

results.title: The Spirit of the beehive = El Espiritu de la colmena
results.creator_credit: Victor Erice, Elias Querejeta and Elias Querejeta Producciones
results.brief_description: This hauntingly atmospheric mood piece is set in rural Spain soon after the Civil War. In the oppressive postwar atmosphere there is an unbridgeable gulf between the parents and children of the household. The parents have retreated into private worlds - beekeeping and an obsession with a ‘lost’ child. After seeing James Whale’s ‘Frankenstein’ at a travelling film show the children conjure the monster up as a playmate. In the mind of the imaginative and impressionable Ana the figure of a fugitive soldier fuses with the figure of the monster. Cast includes Fernando Fernan Gomez, Teresa Gimpera, Ana Torrent, Isabel Telleria. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: A Man escaped = Un Condamne a mort e'est echappe = Le Vent souffle ou il vent
results.creator_credit: Robert Bresson, Jean Thuillier, Alain Poire and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Based on the true life account of Resistance fighter Andre Devigny, who was imprisoned and condemned to death by the Nazis, “A Man Escaped” is one of cinema’s truly poetic films, a study in both the psychology of imprisonment and loss of liberty, as well as a tense and involving study of how a man plotted his escape from one of the most heavily guarded prisons in World War II. As played by Francois Letterier, the condemned man’s initial fear and anger give way to a resolve and determination to defy his fascist captors. But, as his plans are disturbed on the eve of his execution, he achieves a transcendence by accepting the inevitability of fate, the need to trust another human being, and finally having the knowledge that by not surrendering his will - whatever the outcome of his escape - he has truly liberated himself from the enemy. Winner of the Best Director Award a Cannes in 1957, stunningly photographed by L. H. Burel, and featuring an evocative use of Mozart’s Mass in C Minor, this is universally acknowledged as one of Bresson’s supreme works. In French with English subtitles.

But, as his plans are disturbed on the eve of his execution, he achieves a transcendence by accepting the inevitability of fate, the need to trust another human being, and finally having the knowledge that by not surrendering his will - whatever the outcome of his escape - he has truly liberated himself from the enemy. Winner of the Best Director Award a Cannes in 1957, stunningly photographed by L. H. Burel, and featuring an evocative use of Mozart’s Mass in C Minor, this is universally acknowledged as one of Bresson’s supreme works. In French with English subtitles.
